      • isUnsafeLiteral

        public static boolean isUnsafeLiteral(PsiLiteralExpression expression)

        Parameters:
        expression - a literal expression to check
        Returns:
        true if the literal text cannot be safely used to build refactored expression

      • escapeTextBlockCharacters

        public static java.lang.String escapeTextBlockCharacters(java.lang.String s)
        Converts given string to text block content. String is converted as a last string in a text block.
        Parameters:
        s - original text
        See Also:
        escapeTextBlockCharacters(String, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • escapeTextBlockCharacters

        public static java.lang.String escapeTextBlockCharacters(java.lang.String s,
                                                         boolean escapeStartQuote,
                                                         boolean escapeEndQuote,
                                                         boolean escapeSpacesInTheEnd)
        Converts given string to text block content.

        During conversion:

      • All escaped quotes are unescaped.
      • Every third quote is escaped. If escapeStartQuote / escapeEndQuote is set then start / end quote is also escaped.
      • All spaces before \n are converted to \040 escape sequence. This is required since spaces in the end of the line are trimmed by default (see JEP 368). If escapeSpacesInTheEnd is set, then all spaces before the end of the line are converted even if new line in the end is missing.
      • All new line escape sequences are interpreted.
      • Rest of the content is processed as is.
Parameters:
s - original text
escapeStartQuote - true if first quote should be escaped (e.g. when copy-pasting into text block after two quotes)
escapeEndQuote - true if last quote should be escaped (e.g. inserting text into text block before closing quotes)
escapeSpacesInTheEnd - true if spaces in the end of the line should be preserved even if no new line in the end is present

  • escapeBackSlashesInTextBlock

    public static java.lang.String escapeBackSlashesInTextBlock(java.lang.String str)
    Escapes backslashes in a text block (even if they're represented as an escape sequence).

  • parseBackSlash

    public static int parseBackSlash(java.lang.String str,
                                 int idx)
    Parse backslash at given index. It will be parsed even in case when backslash is represented as unicode escape sequence.
    Parameters:
    str - text
    idx - parse from
    Returns:
    index where next char starts, -1 otherwise

  • getTextBlockIndent

    public static int getTextBlockIndent(java.lang.String [] lines)
    Determines how many whitespaces would be excluded at the beginning of each line of text block content. See JEP 368 for more details.
    Parameters:
    lines - text block content

    See Also:

  • mapBackStringRange

    public static TextRange mapBackStringRange(java.lang.String text,
                                           int from,
                                           int to)
    Maps the substring range inside Java String literal value back into the source code range.
    Parameters:
    text - string literal as present in source code (including quotes)
    from - start offset inside the represented string
    to - end offset inside the represented string
    Returns:
    the range which represents the corresponding substring inside source representation, or null if from/to values are out of bounds.

  • mapBackTextBlockRange

    public static TextRange mapBackTextBlockRange(java.lang.String text,
                                              int from,
                                              int to,
                                              int indent)
    Maps the substring range inside Java Text Block literal value back into the source code range.
    Parameters:
    indent - text block indent
    Returns:
    range in source code representation, null when from/to out of bounds or given text block source code representation is invalid
